page.title: 15NICHOLAS LYLE M.P.
page.content: Mr. Lyle M.P. for Mid Beds is strongly opposed to the Elstow proposals. In a recent letter to his constituents he writes " I will do everything I can to persuade NIREX to change their mind and the Department of the Environment not to grant permission for any such development". He believes the "Government should be looking at alternative methods of solving the problem of nuclear waste". He proposes "dry storage on site". He cites the example of other countries such as West Germany and Sweden who have rejected the system of shallow land burial as proposed by NIREX. He concludes "it is unwise to place a nuclear dump of this nature in such a crowded county as Bedfordshire".
